description: Lists the targets assigned to the specified rule. The maximum number of results per page for requests is 100.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: The token returned by a previous call, which you can use to retrieve the next set of results. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call again using the returned token. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Using an expired pagination token results in an HTTP 400 InvalidToken error.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: The targets assigned to the rule.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of the target within the specified rule. Use this ID to reference the target when updating the rule. We recommend using a memorable and unique string.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the target.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be used for this target when the rule is triggered. If one rule triggers multiple targets, you can use a different IAM role for each target.

nested_items.name: Input
nested_items.description: Valid JSON text passed to the target. In this case, nothing from the event itself is passed to the target. For more information, see The JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Data Interchange Format.

nested_items.name: InputPath
nested_items.description: The value of the JSONPath that is used for extracting part of the matched event when passing it to the target. You may use JSON dot notation or bracket notation. For more information about JSON paths, see JSONPath.

nested_items.name: InputTransformer
nested_items.description: Settings to enable you to provide custom input to a target based on certain event data. You can extract one or more key-value pairs from the event and then use that data to send customized input to the target.

nested_items.name: InputPathsMap
nested_items.description: Map of JSON paths to be extracted from the event. You can then insert these in the template in InputTemplate to produce the output you want to be sent to the target.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InputTemplate
nested_items.description: Input template where you specify placeholders that will be filled with the values of the keys from InputPathsMap to customize the data sent to the target. Enclose each InputPathsMaps value in brackets: <value>
The placeholder cannot be used as an object key.

nested_items.name: KinesisParameters
nested_items.description: The custom parameter you can use to control the shard assignment, when the target is a Kinesis data stream. If you do not include this parameter, the default is to use the eventId as the partition key.

nested_items.name: PartitionKeyPath
nested_items.description: The JSON path to be extracted from the event and used as the partition key. For more information, see Amazon Kinesis Streams Key Concepts in the Amazon Kinesis Streams Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: RunCommandParameters
nested_items.description: Parameters used when you are using the rule to invoke Amazon EC2 Run Command.

nested_items.name: RunCommandTargets
nested_items.description: Currently, we support including only one RunCommandTarget block, which specifies either an array of InstanceIds or a tag.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: Can be either tag: tag-key or InstanceIds.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: If Key is tag: tag-key, Values is a list of tag values. If Key is InstanceIds, Values is a list of Amazon EC2 instance IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EcsParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the Amazon ECS task definition and task count to be used, if the event target is an Amazon ECS task. For more information about Amazon ECS tasks, see Task Definitions in the Amazon EC2 Container Service Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: TaskDefinitionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the task definition to use if the event target is an Amazon ECS task.

nested_items.name: TaskCount
nested_items.description: The number of tasks to create based on TaskDefinition. The default is 1.

nested_items.name: LaunchType
nested_items.description: Specifies the launch type on which your task is running. The launch type that you specify here must match one of the launch type (compatibilities) of the target task. The FARGATE value is supported only in the Regions where Fargate with Amazon ECS is supported. For more information, see Fargate on Amazon ECS in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: NetworkConfiguration
nested_items.description: Use this structure if the Amazon ECS task uses the awsvpc network mode. This structure specifies the VPC subnets and security groups associated with the task, and whether a public IP address is to be used. This structure is required if LaunchType is FARGATE because the awsvpc mode is required for Fargate tasks.

nested_items.name: awsvpcConfiguration
nested_items.description: Use this structure to specify the VPC subnets and security groups for the task, and whether a public IP address is to be used. This structure is relevant only for ECS tasks that use the awsvpc network mode.

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: Specifies the subnets associated with the task. These subnets must all be in the same VPC. You can specify as many as 16 subnets.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: Specifies the security groups associated with the task. These security groups must all be in the same VPC. You can specify as many as five security groups. If you do not specify a security group, the default security group for the VPC is used.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AssignPublicIp
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the task's elastic network interface receives a public IP address. You can specify ENABLED only when LaunchType in EcsParameters is set to FARGATE.

nested_items.name: PlatformVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies the platform version for the task. Specify only the numeric portion of the platform version, such as 1.1.0.

nested_items.name: Group
nested_items.description: Specifies an ECS task group for the task. The maximum length is 255 characters.

nested_items.name: CapacityProviderStrategy
nested_items.description: The capacity provider strategy to use for the task.

nested_items.name: capacityProvider
nested_items.description: The short name of the capacity provider.

nested_items.name: weight
nested_items.description: The weight value designates the relative percentage of the total number of tasks launched that should use the specified capacity provider. The weight value is taken into consideration after the base value, if defined, is satisfied.

nested_items.name: base
nested_items.description: The base value designates how many tasks, at a minimum, to run on the specified capacity provider. Only one capacity provider in a capacity provider strategy can have a base defined. If no value is specified, the default value of 0 is used.

nested_items.name: EnableECSManagedTags
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to enable Amazon ECS managed tags for the task. For more information, see Tagging Your Amazon ECS Resources in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: EnableExecuteCommand
nested_items.description: Whether or not to enable the execute command functionality for the containers in this task. If true, this enables execute command functionality on all containers in the task.

nested_items.name: PlacementConstraints
nested_items.description: An array of placement constraint objects to use for the task. You can specify up to 10 constraints per task (including constraints in the task definition and those specified at runtime).

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of constraint. Use distinctInstance to ensure that each task in a particular group is running on a different container instance. Use memberOf to restrict the selection to a group of valid candidates.

nested_items.name: expression
nested_items.description: A cluster query language expression to apply to the constraint. You cannot specify an expression if the constraint type is distinctInstance. To learn more, see Cluster Query Language in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: PlacementStrategy
nested_items.description: The placement strategy objects to use for the task. You can specify a maximum of five strategy rules per task.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of placement strategy. The random placement strategy randomly places tasks on available candidates. The spread placement strategy spreads placement across available candidates evenly based on the field parameter. The binpack strategy places tasks on available candidates that have the least available amount of the resource that is specified with the field parameter. For example, if you binpack on memory, a task is placed on the instance with the least amount of remaining memory (but still enough to run the task).

nested_items.name: field
nested_items.description: The field to apply the placement strategy against. For the spread placement strategy, valid values are instanceId (or host, which has the same effect), or any platform or custom attribute that is applied to a container instance, such as attribute:ecs.availability-zone. For the binpack placement strategy, valid values are cpu and memory. For the random placement strategy, this field is not used.

nested_items.name: PropagateTags
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition to the task. If no value is specified, the tags are not propagated. Tags can only be propagated to the task during task creation. To add tags to a task after task creation, use the TagResource API action.

nested_items.name: ReferenceId
nested_items.description: The reference ID to use for the task.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The metadata that you apply to the task to help you categorize and organize them. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. To learn more, see RunTask in the Amazon ECS API Reference.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A string you can use to assign a value. The combination of tag keys and values can help you organize and categorize your resources.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the specified tag key.

nested_items.name: BatchParameters
nested_items.description: If the event target is an Batch job, this contains the job definition, job name, and other parameters. For more information, see Jobs in the Batch User Guide.

nested_items.name: JobDefinition
nested_items.description: The ARN or name of the job definition to use if the event target is an Batch job. This job definition must already exist.

nested_items.name: JobName
nested_items.description: The name to use for this execution of the job, if the target is an Batch job.

nested_items.name: ArrayProperties
nested_items.description: The array properties for the submitted job, such as the size of the array. The array size can be between 2 and 10,000. If you specify array properties for a job, it becomes an array job. This parameter is used only if the target is an Batch job.

nested_items.name: Size
nested_items.description: The size of the array, if this is an array batch job. Valid values are integers between 2 and 10,000.

nested_items.name: RetryStrategy
nested_items.description: The retry strategy to use for failed jobs, if the target is an Batch job. The retry strategy is the number of times to retry the failed job execution. Valid values are 1---10. When you specify a retry strategy here, it overrides the retry strategy defined in the job definition.

nested_items.name: Attempts
nested_items.description: The number of times to attempt to retry, if the job fails. Valid values are 1---10.

nested_items.name: SqsParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the message group ID to use when the target is a FIFO queue.

nested_items.name: MessageGroupId
nested_items.description: The FIFO message group ID to use as the target.

nested_items.name: HttpParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the HTTP parameters to use when the target is a API Gateway endpoint or EventBridge ApiDestination.

nested_items.name: PathParameterValues
nested_items.description: The path parameter values to be used to populate API Gateway API or EventBridge ApiDestination path wildcards ('*').
(string) ---

nested_items.name: HeaderParameters
nested_items.description: The headers that need to be sent as part of request invoking the API Gateway API or EventBridge ApiDestination.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: QueryStringParameters
nested_items.description: The query string keys/values that need to be sent as part of request invoking the API Gateway API or EventBridge ApiDestination.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RedshiftDataParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the Amazon Redshift Data API parameters to use when the target is a Amazon Redshift cluster.

nested_items.name: SecretManagerArn
nested_items.description: The name or ARN of the secret that enables access to the database. Required when authenticating using Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: Database
nested_items.description: The name of the database. Required when authenticating using temporary credentials.

nested_items.name: DbUser
nested_items.description: The database user name. Required when authenticating using temporary credentials.

nested_items.name: Sql
nested_items.description: The SQL statement text to run.

nested_items.name: StatementName
nested_items.description: The name of the SQL statement. You can name the SQL statement when you create it to identify the query.

nested_items.name: WithEvent
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to send an event back to EventBridge after the SQL statement runs.

nested_items.name: Sqls
nested_items.description: One or more SQL statements to run. The SQL statements are run as a single transaction. They run serially in the order of the array. Subsequent SQL statements don't start until the previous statement in the array completes. If any SQL statement fails, then because they are run as one transaction, all work is rolled back.
(string) --- A single Redshift SQL.

nested_items.name: SageMakerPipelineParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the SageMaker AI Model Building Pipeline parameters to start execution of a SageMaker AI Model Building Pipeline.

nested_items.name: PipelineParameterList
nested_items.description: List of Parameter names and values for SageMaker AI Model Building Pipeline execution.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Name of parameter to start execution of a SageMaker AI Model Building Pipeline.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: Value of parameter to start execution of a SageMaker AI Model Building Pipeline.

nested_items.name: DeadLetterConfig
nested_items.description: The DeadLetterConfig that defines the target queue to send dead-letter queue events to.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the SQS queue specified as the target for the dead-letter queue.

nested_items.name: RetryPolicy
nested_items.description: The retry policy configuration to use for the dead-letter queue.

nested_items.name: MaximumRetryAttempts
nested_items.description: The maximum number of retry attempts to make before the request fails. Retry attempts continue until either the maximum number of attempts is made or until the duration of the MaximumEventAgeInSeconds is met.

nested_items.name: MaximumEventAgeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, to continue to make retry attempts.

nested_items.name: AppSyncParameters
nested_items.description: Contains the GraphQL operation to be parsed and executed, if the event target is an AppSync API.

nested_items.name: GraphQLOperation
nested_items.description: The GraphQL operation; that is, the query, mutation, or subscription to be parsed and executed by the GraphQL service.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A token indicating there are more results available. If there are no more results, no token is included in the response.
